page.title: 13PLACE NAMES
page.content: Many of the houses in the village,both new and old,take their names from the old field names.The name 'Southfields'goes back to the time before the Norman Conquest when there would be two large fields cultivated in strips.'Chessels'was the Saxon name for a place where Roman remains were discovered.The newest estate of council houses has been named Withy Hays,this being the ancient title of the field where they were built.'Broadshord' is a cottage in the field of that name which was shorn off Broad Close.Some of the fields retain their ancient names, Big Wherl being known to the original villagers as Gurt Wherl;this is the largest field in the village.Sandpits, Brandirons,Quarry Breach,Matford and Walkmoor possibly reflect their uses in days gone by.
